text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] be a space with an inner product, and let [mathjaxinline]v\in V[/mathjaxinline] be a fixed non-zero vector. Define [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] to be the set of all vectors [mathjaxinline]w\in V[/mathjaxinline] with the property that [mathjaxinline]\langle v,w\rangle = 0[/mathjaxinline].
On Homework 4 you proved that [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] is a subspace of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline]. In this problem, we'll find its dimension.

Suppose that [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] has dimension [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline]. Define the function [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] with domain [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] by [mathjaxinline]T(w) = \langle v, w\rangle[/mathjaxinline]. [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] is a linear transformation (you are encouraged to prove this on your own) with what codomain?
What is the rank of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] (your answer can be in terms of [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline])?
Note that [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] is exactly the kernel of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline]. What is the dimension of [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline]?
